step1.sentence: After the company funded his entire career, he turned around and sued them — a clear case of biting the hand that feeds.

step2.story: Marcus had relied on his mentor's connections to land every major client he ever had. Yet when his mentor needed a favor in return, Marcus publicly criticized him to impress a new business partner. Everyone in the industry agreed he was biting the hand that feeds.

step3.story: For three years, the small publishing house had taken a chance on Elena, printing her books when no one else would and promoting her work tirelessly. Her debut novel became a modest success, and the publisher celebrated her like family. Then, when a larger firm came calling with a lucrative offer, Elena not only signed with them but gave an interview mocking her original publisher as 'small-time.' The literary community was stunned — here was someone openly biting the hand that feeds. Her new publisher noticed too, and quietly wondered if she would do the same to them someday.

meaning.realUsageKo: 자신을 돕거나 지원해 준 사람에게 해를 끼치거나 배신하는 행동을 비유적으로 표현할 때 사용한다. 주로 배은망덕한 태도를 비판할 때 쓴다.
meaning.etymologyKo: 먹이를 주는 주인의 손을 무는 개의 행동에서 유래한 표현으로, 중세 영어 문헌에서부터 등장하며 에드먼드 버크(Edmund Burke)가 1770년 저술에서 이 표현을 사용해 널리 알려졌다.
meaning.nuanceKo: 강한 도덕적 비난을 담은 표현으로, 어리석음과 배은망덕함을 동시에 지적하는 뉘앙스가 있다. 주로 제3자가 누군가의 행동을 비판할 때 사용한다.
meaning.shortExampleEn: He bit the hand that fed him by leaking company secrets to a rival firm.
meaning.shortExampleKo: 그는 경쟁사에 회사 기밀을 유출함으로써 자신을 키워 준 회사를 배신했다.
